course.subject: LABU
course.name: Effective Communication in Business
course.description: The course organizes a student’s previously acquired English language skills into a useful managerial toolkit targeted toward specific business applications and strategies. Students learn how to adapt and apply their English language abilities to real-world assignments within their business major and, after graduation, to career tasks and opportunities. Positioned toward the latter portion of a student’s undergraduate business education, the course prepares students to succeed in their remaining university assignments (such as research tools, written tests, presentations, interviews, meetings, collaborative assignments, interpersonal communication and so forth) as well as the communication challenges they can expect in their careers. For students in their third or fourth year of study who have this course as a program requirement.

reviews.author: Nathan CC
reviews.title: God-like killer (Kill yourself if you want)
reviews.comment_content: Typical labu stuff. Useless interview skills + rubbish impromptu speech + garbage pitching.
reviews.comment_teaching: One of the most boring labu class I have ever attended. Just reading from the typical powerpoint with no jokes and funny stories. Most of the students just did other things in her class. This showed how bad she was.
reviews.comment_grading:
Ate my first C in my UST life thanks to Martha. God-tier killer. She gave me every task a marginal grade which I don't fxxking understand because my english is quite good in my opinion. I got 2 summer intern offers and she gave me marginal score in job interview assessment??? WTF?? Are you f**king kidding me Martha???
I got Bs from my previous labu classes which I put nearly no effort to the tasks. This god-tier killer would kill you no matter what. If you want to get a free C range, feel free to register her class.

reviews.author: Lea
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite useful for future job hunting but may not be useful for fluent English speakers. Mainly learnt interview skills and presentation skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice and quite interesting, but the content in this Labu course is quite simple anyway. She explained things briefly and gave us a lot of time to practice techniques.
reviews.comment_grading: She's tries to give good grades and mentioned that she does not like to give bad grades
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not too bad compared to other Labu courses. There are 3 assessments (mock interview, impromptu speech and presentation). If you have taken labu2051 and labu2052 the presentation should be easy.

reviews.author: chchanca+++vcv
reviews.title: KILLER - 但係爛grade無悔
reviews.comment_content:
Business presentations:
1. Job interviews
2. Impromptus speech
3. Start-up idea pitch

The course has successfully equipped me with the business presentation skills - valuable to get job offers and doing public presentations in business setting.

Successful presentation = Professional + Clear
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good. The instructor effectively taught how to make successful presentations - making audience remember the messages.
reviews.comment_grading:
POOR. GRADE KILLER.

My personal experience:
3 tasks: all competent or above - Result: B-
(Note: the grades for the third presentation task were not publicly disclosed - I wrote email to the instructor to ask for my grades)

I thought I was able to score B+ since I participated actively during class.

This is a course where I have polished up my presentation skills while scored a terrible grade.

Think about which one matters more before enrolling with Dinesh - to learn something? to get good grade?
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair.

1. Job interview - little workload
2. Impromptus speech - little workload
3. Start-up idea pitch - large workload - need to create professional PPT and have several times of presentation  practice

reviews.author: stephanie1234
reviews.title: Last Labu Course!
reviews.comment_content: It is useful for me because I learnt a lot of tips to present myself well in both interviews and public-speaking and also received useful feedback from Eunice.
reviews.comment_teaching: Eunice doesn't have strict rules in judging the performance. It can be a good thing or a bad thing. Because you can express your idea creatively (of course with reasonable thinking), but it is also easy to get lost and confused since Eunice would not give clear standards and guidelines to you. For the group project, even If you ask her for opinions, she will mostly reply you with nothing.
reviews.comment_grading: Eunice is really generous in grading. Since the marks she has given to me were not really high, my scores were mostly around "Very Good" and maybe some "Competent". And I have never had "Excellent" but then I still got A range and that surprises me.
reviews.comment_workload:
Much less to do compared to the previous LABU courses.
1. Interview: Just try to present yourself confidently and logically, remember to stress yourself as a very good fit for the job position.
2. Impromptu: Just a 3-min speech, not much to prepare. (But you may want to watch some Ted shows and look how people present their ideas)
3. Group Presentation
Our topic was to suggest ideas for the new center in UST.
The coordination between your teammates is very important because group mark counts a lot!!

reviews.author: Delos
reviews.comment_content: Quite helpful - we practiced job interview skills, impromptu speaking and a group pitch. We learned some appropriate skills and most of it can be applied to the work environment.
reviews.comment_teaching: Excellent teacher! He always gives lots of consultations and feedback. Keven really knows the materials and is very engaged with his students.
reviews.comment_grading: Kevin is a grade killer. He has very high expectations and it can be impossible to get to the level he expects.
reviews.comment_workload: Too much workload. Though there is no writing to do in this course, the group work for the pitch was too much.

reviews.author: Jimmylam
reviews.comment_content: All labu 2020 course content and materials are the same, so can seek friends' in other T for some advice. The cases are not difficult, you need to generate feasible and comprehensive solution to tackle the dilemma faced.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Levi is quite funny and he will give full explanation and guidance on understanding the case and generating solution. You will find at the end the whole class have almost the same solutions LOL

At the end of the course, there will be a fun lesson haha
reviews.comment_grading:
Two speaking assessment(presentation)
Two essay(report, but basically just the written form of the presentation but need to add some logic flow and evidence)
Peer evalution

No midterms or exams!!!

All got competence had B+
reviews.comment_workload: all classes would have the same workload so it doesn't differ a lot

reviews.author: avv
reviews.title: The best LABU
reviews.comment_content: This course is to help you with your job search such as interviews, presenting a convincing sales pitch and impromptu speaking.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Shaun is quite a friendly instructor. My previous LABU instructors were quite mean in certain ways, so Shaun was a great relief.

He makes the classroom atmosphere quite relaxed and highly appreciates active participation from students.
reviews.comment_grading: He is a good grader and as long you put a decent amount of genuine effort, it is definitely possible to score B+ or above.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is lesser and not demanding like the previous LABUs.

The main assessments are:
1. Individual interview: Definitely research through common interview questions and practice giving suitable responses.  

2. Impromptu Speech
3. Sales pitch which is a group presentation.

reviews.author: Cat
reviews.title: Thanks Delian
reviews.comment_content:
Actually, I don't really think how Labu helped prepare me in this business world...it was not that practical at all

This Labu was even a bit "without substance" as it focused on speaking only so it didn't require as much work as in previous Labu courses.

Three tasks in this course:
1. mock interview
2. take a stand (impromptu speech)
3. pitching
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice woman, I was taught by her in Labu 2051 before :) so I enrolled her course 2020 this sem
reviews.comment_grading:
7 marks is the highest and it is based on task fulfillment, delivery-visual and delivery-verbal and vocal.

My marks:
Task 1: 666
Task 2: 766
Task 3: 555

Grade: A-

Really thanks Delian as i did not perform that good in task 3 as i didn't have enough space to present (to move)<-- excuse haha

In my previous Labu I only got B from her.

reviews.author: olle
reviews.title: easy A if you are active, easy C if you are shy
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly about job interview, CV, giving a speech to a small crowd, giving a business idea in PPT style. I think this course is meant to help students be used to talk in public once we get jobs.
HOWEVER, I really think that this type of course should be offered as workshops instead of a 2-credit course. I think this course encourages students to write CV simply to satisfy the professor instead of expressing themselves. Also, the job interview asked me the weirdest question like "What is 76 X 45?" and he took some points of mine for answering a number far off from the answer (wtf this aint a math course KK)
reviews.comment_teaching:
KK prepares well for the class. He gives out helpful advice to each student in class. When doing in class activities, students will find him walking around to stop by if anyone needs help. I personally got a lot of help from his advice like "speak slowly" "show that you believe what you're saying", and so on.
Some people think he is a harsh grader, but when combined all LABU classes' grades, it turned out that his gradings were average so all other classes' grades were adjusted to his marks (which means he is actually a very fair grader)
reviews.comment_grading:
As long as you practice a lot during in class activities KK gives you and participates in class, it should be fine. KK gives only 1 A+ per class.

Did pretty okay in job interview (got very good for all three sections of grading)
speech to the class (very good for two sections, excellent for one section)
business idea presentation (group project) (excellent for all sections)

Got an A

I liked how this LABU course required more individual work rather than group work. Also, don't miss more than 2 classes because you will then fail!
reviews.comment_workload:
Compared to other LABU classes with heavy case analysis and presentation, this LABU class required almost no workload. If you originally are a talkative person who does not get nervous talking to the crowd, you do not need any extra work outside class (which was my case).
But, I've seen a lot of my shy friends in class struggling. They practiced a lot to not be nervous. But still, the workload is really light compared to other LABU course.

reviews.author: cysummm
reviews.comment_content:
There are three assignments in this
1. Mock Interview
2. Impromptu Speech
3. Pitching ideas (Group presentation)

The mock job interview focus on improving your interview by teaching you different method dealing with behavioural questions and challenging. I found this part very useful when we are going to do lots of interview in the coming years.

Impromptu speech is a relatively challenging task. 3 minutes preparation and 3 minutes on stage. Angie gave us the questions in the past and let us practice a lot in class.

Pitching an idea is a group project. It requires us to suggest a new business in the current information centre in campus. It requires ~ 16 mins + 4 mins QnA.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her accent is ok to understand (hk accent) but just too many "ok" and "you know what I mean" in the class. Also, she would try her best to read out/ ensure us to go through all the powerpoint slide. So that might be a bit boring sometimes.

Also, she is not that kind of tutor that will arrive the classroom super early. So, the time of taking attendance is less strict than other tutors.
reviews.comment_grading:
It heard that Angie is a killer from msssug but I would say its fair.
Not killer but not very good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is lighter than 2 previous labu courses. As all the tasks are examining oral skills, it require less time to prepare.

The only part you would put more time in is the pitching idea. However, the schedule in that part is a bit rush.

reviews.author: KKKKK
reviews.title: Eunice俾grade算係咁
reviews.comment_content:
3 assignments
1. 模擬Hang Seng MT Interview：其實好hea，1min自我介紹，跟住系一set預先發放既question list抽兩條問題出離問。（我考前一堂無翻無攞到條list食左屎，其他人全部問題prep曬）
2. Impromptu Speech：5min preparation，5min speech，至少要講4分鐘，如果唔係instructor局住俾低分
3. Pitching to the investors：group assignment自行分組，講15min，自己隨便搵一個商品去做pitching，吸引investor投資。
reviews.comment_teaching: 教既野大家都差唔多，Eunice教得算係咁，無Nora咁chur但又無Danyal咁hea。重點要教既都教到，btw Eunice以前做ibank所以有相關想問既都可以問。
reviews.comment_grading:
Mock Inteview: 25%
Impromptu: 30%
Pitching: 30%
Participation: 10%
Peer Evaluation: 5%
我mock interview講得好差，一直重複又無咩content，但佢language都俾左個5我(3,5,4)，impromptu算係剛好挨到4分幾鐘(5,4,5)，pitching有充足preparation都算講得唔錯(5,5,6,6)
最後B
reviews.comment_workload:
正常labu course workload都偏高，尤其以2 cred course黎計
特別係group assignment d group mate多數都好chur。
不過interview預先有question list, impromptu又無得prep，所以我覺得呢個都算係眾多labu course之中比較輕鬆既一個。

reviews.author: Ly95
reviews.comment_content: Didn't learn anything from this LABU course.Try to get well prepared for the last assessment because it's the only task that you can prepare beforehand.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is nice(and kind of hea).
reviews.comment_workload: Very small workload if compared to LABU2051&2052. 3 assessments (mock interview, impromptu speech and presentation). Mock interview is the easiet asssessment so you should try your very best to preapare for it. I think for impromptu speech they dont expect too much so just try to be confident and fluent. Focus on preparing mock interview and group presentation.

reviews.author: whdbsgml
reviews.comment_content: This class helps you to learn about more practical aspect of "presenting yourself" such as interviews and impromtu (short speech)
reviews.comment_teaching: Jessie is a nice instructor. She prepares a lot of content for the class that really helps you to get prepared for the assignment that you have to do. She also puts in extra time to give advise on you current performance (you do practice of each assignments either in class or as homework (not graded)). I thought it was really helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Job Interview (20%)
Take a Stand (TAS) (25%)
Team Presentations (35%)
Online Peer Evaluation of Leadership & Teamwork (5%)
Participation (15%)
reviews.comment_workload:
It's lighter than other LABU classes since it is mostly individual work. Also, you cannot really prepare for the interview and impromtu because you only get to know the topic at the assessment.
However, attendance is a must so I recommend taking the class that you know you can make to every single one. (i.e avoid 9am classes if you tend to sleep in)

reviews.author: Tegwen
reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.comment_content: Useful managerial toolkit targeted toward specific business applications and strategies. Students learn how to adapt and apply their English language abilities to real-world assignments within their business major and, after graduation, to career tasks and opportunities. Positioned toward the latter portion of a student’s undergraduate business education, the course prepares students to succeed in their remaining university assignments (such as research tools, written tests, presentations, interviews, meetings, collaborative assignments, interpersonal communication and so forth) as well as the communication challenges they can expect in their careers.
reviews.comment_workload:
The are three assessments in total:
1) Job interview - applying as a management trainee at Hang Seng Bank  
2) Take a stand assessment - 5-minute impromptu speech on an assigned topic
3) Group presentation - solutions for cathay pacific catering services

reviews.author: 1_chris
reviews.title: 係King of Killer手中拎到好Grade
reviews.comment_content: 都係普通Labu Course, 睇你英文點, 最主要都係Presentation既技巧, 加埋上堂Participation既分數
reviews.comment_teaching: 之前LABU 2051都比佢教過, 個次佢就Kill左我, 今次就冇; 不過我其實都幾鍾意佢教 (如果唔係點會比佢Kill過一次仲敢上佢堂); 佢教得比較生動D, 好多時候都會強調自己想要大家做到D咩野出黎, 亦都比好多時間大家去Practice :)
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Mock Job Interview, 恆生MT Interview, 重點係睇你點樣Sell到你自己, 動作又唔好太緊張生硬, 20%
2. Take a Stand (TAS), 即場拎個Topic諗2/3分鐘, 跟住做個5分鐘既Persuasive Talk, 25%
3. Team Presentations, 國泰Catering Service既Case, 會有Q&A, 35%
4. Online Peer Evaluation of Leadership & Teamwork, 5%
5. Participation, 你懂的, 15%

FYI,
就o個3個Assessment黎講, 1) 同 3) 都做得麻麻地, 2) 做得好.
平時上堂都有主動答下佢野, 可能呢方面救返我個Grade掛.
最後A-, 都幾滿意 :)
reviews.comment_workload:
唔係特別多, 好多都係堂上既Activity, 除左3次Assessment之外冇其他野要準備;
Job interview 如果有做過Intern可能都已經Prepare過見工個陣既野; TAS更加唔洗準備, 最鍾意呢個Assessment Lol; Team Presentation多野做少少, 不過Overall黎講Workload唔大!

reviews.title: 一定要食ge屎
reviews.comment_content:
1 mock interview（去In heng seng bank MT）
1 take a stand（即時比個topic你諗一陣 講5分鐘）
1 group case presentation (cathay pacific)
(focus on both present skills and visual aids)
reviews.comment_teaching: 我係靚仔ENGLAND教，佢應該grading都唔差。有LABUMATE MOCK 同TAS表現同我差唔多 但佢GROUP PRESENT應該好過我同無比人E死 B左。 所以同LABUMATE打好關係 同唔好freeride人好緊要，要扮到好active係其中之一，一係你就lead住個group去做野，咁樣做應該唔會比人E死，我呢d毒撚就比人E死左。
reviews.comment_grading: C 左，英文差的好自為知。
reviews.comment_workload: workload 唔算太大，因為準備到的野，除左最後個case presentation，頭兩樣都係睇你平時英文底子係點

reviews.author: leo lee
reviews.title: labu2020
reviews.comment_content: its all about how to enhance your English in term of business usage. Focus a lot on how to present yourself
reviews.comment_teaching: She has worked in ibank before and knows a lot of interview skills. If you want to get some useful hints, just enroll into her class
reviews.comment_grading: not bad. Dont know about other classes or my classmates. As long as you can show her you pay attention to her class then you can get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: very light workload. Just pay attention to her class. No take home cases/readings at all.
